Title.En: Engineering Solutions for Inclusive & Sustainable Live Music

Description.En:
Music plays a vital role in creating shared experiences and bringing people together. However, organizing and broadcasting a cultural event is no easy task. Festivals and municipalities must rethink how they design accessible, sustainable, and engaging experiences for all audiences—including people with disabilities, children, and underprivileged communities.

This is where our challenge comes in. Stepping into the role of creative engineers, students will collaborate with local stakeholders to develop innovative solutions that make music accessible to everyone. How can we design inclusive experiences that allow people with mobility restrictions or sensory impairments to fully participate in a festival? How can a city ensure that a cultural event reaches all its citizens, regardless of their background? How can we reduce the environmental impact of large-scale music events?

Over just a few days, student teams will tackle these critical questions, combining creativity, technology, and user-centered design to develop concrete, practical solutions. Their work will not only offer fresh perspectives but also provide actionable strategies for local decision-makers.

Title.En: Identify user/client needs and formulate innovate opportunities

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, you will be able to identify user/client needs and formulate potential innovative opportunities in response to them.

Title.En: Implement innovation and creative processes to develop innovative solutions

PrefLabel.En: working with digital devices and applications

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, you will be able to implement appropriate innovation and creative process in order to develop innovative and dynamic solutions using digital devices and applications.

Title.En: Deliver a project as part of a team

PrefLabel.En: organising, planning and scheduling work and activities

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, you will be able to work efficiently as part of a multicultural and multidisciplinary team.

Title.En: Communicate an original concept concisely, clearly, and persuasively

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge you will be able to produce a concise, clear, and convincing way to promote an original concept.

Title.En: Engineering Solutions for Inclusive & Sustainable Live Music
Engineering Solutions for Inclusive & Sustainable Live Music

LegalName.En: INSTITUT NATIONAL DES SCIENCES APPLIQUEES DE TOULOUSE (INSA TOULOUSE)

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**Online Learning**

📅 June 12, 10 AM (CET) | Duration: 2 hours

Online session covering the fundamentals of design thinking.

Icebreaker activities to connect with other ECIU students.

**In-Person Learning**

📅 On-site week: June 21–27 | 38 hours + 10 hours independent work

🎶 Arrival & Cultural Immersion (Optional, June 21-22)

This year’s challenge focuses on music!

Students are strongly encouraged to extend their mobility to seven days in order to attend the Fête de la Musique concerts, organized by the challenge providers. The Fête de la Musique is a nationwide celebration of music and musicians, held annually on the summer solstice (June 21st). In addition to organized events, musicians of all levels take to the streets, filling cities and towns across France with free performances. For one day—and night—the entire country transforms into a vibrant, open-air musical festival. And you're invited!

This will serve as an exciting introduction to the program and giving you hands-on experience of accessible live music in France.

🛠 Challenge Week Schedule (Mandatory, June 23-27)

Day 1: Immersive fieldwork—interact with professionals, users, and stakeholders to gather insights for your project.

Days 2-3: Define your target audience, project specifications, and objectives using design thinking methodology.

Days 3-4: Develop a preliminary project and convince others of its feasibility by proposing technical solutions, supported by prototypes, mock-ups, and budgets.

Day 5: Present your final project to a panel of experts.

⏳ Total learning time: 50 hours

--

**Evaluation**

Throughout the challenge, you will submit key deliverables:

- End of Day 1: Report on market investigation and observation summary.
- End of Day 2: Report on project specifications and identified needs.
- End of Day 4: Final deliverables—report, presentation, mock-up, or video of your proposed solution.
- Day 5: Final project defense in front of a panel.

**Funding for international mobility**

Please contact your home university for information regarding financial support for international mobility. There might be an early deadline for this, so contact your local team as early as possible. [You can also contact ECIU directly via the contact form.](https://engage.eciu.eu/contact.)

**Organising travel**

You are responsible for organising your own travel to INSA Hauts-de-France (Valenciennes, France).

This challenge immerses students in the heart of the creative process, using design thinking to develop innovative products and services. Each year, the Créathon training program explores a different theme in collaboration with industry stakeholders.

This year, the focus is on music—ensuring its widest possible reach. The challenge will explore music’s use, practice, listening habits, and accessibility to new audiences. The program’s partners play a key role in enriching the cultural life of Hauts-de-France (Northern France), including concert venues, performance spaces, public authorities, and music schools.

Following online sessions on the fundamentals of design thinking, the challenge takes place on-site through a 5-day mobility program (which can be extended to 7 days). If you opt for the 7-day mobility, you will participate in the Fête de la Musique, a nationwide celebration of music, prior to the start of the challenge week, using it as a live case study. During the obligatory 5-day mobility week, you will then form creative teams of six and engage in five intensive days of hands-on problem-solving—interwoven with inspiring musical events.

Interested students should apply by sending a CV, and a transcript of records at least one week before the deadline. Students should be ready to work in international teams with a compulsory mobility in Northern France.

Once accepted, candidates will be required to provide proof of commitment by submitting supporting documents for their travel and accommodation bookings.

**Admission process**

We process applications toward the end of the application period. If your application is accepted, you will receive an offer sent to your ECIU email address.

Please remember to check your ECIU email and spam folder regularly, and note that you have 3 days to accept your offer.
